tool.name: TargetedFileConverter
tool.description: Converts different transition files for targeted proteomics / metabolomics analysis.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${out_type}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out'

param.name: in
param.label: Input file to convert
param.help: See http://www.openms.de/current_doxygen/html/UTILS_TargetedFileConverter.html for format of OpenSWATH transition TSV file or SpectraST MRM file select mrm,pqp,tabular,traml data sets(s)

param.name: out_type
param.label: Output file type -- default: determined from file extension or contentNote: that not all conversion paths work or make sense

param.name: retentionTimeInterpretation
param.label: How to interpret the provided retention time (the retention time column can either be interpreted to be in iRT, minutes or seconds)

param.name: override_group_label_check
param.label: Override an internal check that assures that all members of the same PeptideGroupLabel have the same PeptideSequence (this ensures that only different isotopic forms of the same peptide can be grouped together in the same label group)
param.help: Only turn this off if you know what you are doing

param.name: force_invalid_mods
param.label: Force reading even if invalid modifications are encountered (OpenMS may not recognize the modification)

param.name: legacy_traml_id
param.label: PQP to TraML: Should legacy TraML IDs be used?

tool.help:
Converts different transition files for targeted proteomics / metabolomics analysis.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_TargetedFileConverter.html
